name: BeeEntityHelper
description: The BeeEntityHelper class is a thin wrapper around Minecraft’s net.minecraft.entity.passive.BeeEntity. It provides convenient methods for querying the bee’s state (nectar, anger, stinging) while exposing the underlying entity through the base field inherited from AnimalEntityHelper.
overview: BeeEntityHelper is used when you have a reference to a bee entity (e.g., from a world scan, ray‑trace, or entity event) and need to check or react to its bee‑specific properties.

constructors.description: Creates a new helper instance that wraps the supplied BeeEntity.

parameters.name: beeEntity
parameters.description: The raw Minecraft bee entity to wrap.

methods.name: hasNectar
methods.description: Returns true if the bee currently holds nectar.

methods.name: isAngry
methods.description: Returns true if the bee is angry at a player.

methods.name: hasStung
methods.description: Returns true if the bee has already stung a player.
